intro: Flourensia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive central disk. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive blooms.
